source_note: Baseline from West Virginia DEP Rehabilitation/Environmental programs and municipal guidance; local rules vary.

organics.guidance: Composting of yard/food waste permitted; programs are local.
organics.bin: Yard waste cart or compost drop-off where offered.
organics.notes: Home composting encouraged; limited curbside food scrap service.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Bottles and jars only; rinse and remove lids.
glass_containers.bin: Glass drop-off or separate collection where available.

metal_containers.guidance: Aluminum and steel/tin cans, empty and rinsed.
metal_containers.notes: No scrap metal or pressurized cans.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries via HHW or retail sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of trash and curbside recycling.

e_waste.guidance: Use county e-waste events or recyclers; some landfill bans for specific items.
e_waste.notes: Accepted items vary; check county solid waste authority.

bulky_items.guidance: Arrange special pickup or deliver to transfer station/landfill.
provenance: County solid waste authorities in WV
